meanings.definition: Serving as an introduction or prelude.
meanings.sent1: The preluding music set the mood for the rest of the performance.
meanings.sent2: Her preluding remarks gave a hint of what was to come.
meanings.sent3: The preluding decorations made the party feel extra special.
meanings.sent4: The preluding sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The preluding scene in the movie captured everyone's attention immediately.

meanings.definition: To serve as a prelude or introduction.
meanings.sent1: The soft piano notes preluding the main melody created a sense of anticipation.
meanings.sent2: The speaker began by preluding the topic with a brief history.
meanings.sent3: The chef preluding the meal with a unique appetizer that surprised the guests.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds preluding the rain darkened the sky ominously.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds preluding the sunrise signaled the start of a new day.
